API reference¶

  • pdover2t.pipe

pdover2t computational subsea pipeline engineering.

pdover2t.pipe¶

pdover2t.pipe.pipe_props.Di_from_pipe_Do(Do, WT)[source]¶

Calculate pipe inner diameter (Di), given a reference outer diameter (Do) and a wall thickness dimension (WT). WT can be a list or tuple of wall thicknesses for compound section pipes.

\[D_i = D_o - 2 * WT\]
Parameters

  • Do – pipe outer diameter \((D_o)\)

  • WT (float, list, tuple) – pipe wall thickness, or list/tuple of wall thicknesses

Returns

pipe inner diameter \((D_i)\)

Return type

float

>>> Di_from_pipe_Do(203.2, 3.0)
197.2
pdover2t.pipe.pipe_props.Do_from_pipe_Di(Di, WT)[source]¶

Calculate pipe outer diameter (Do), given a reference inner diameter (Di) and a wall thickness dimension (WT). WT can be a list or tuple of wall thicknesses for compound section pipes.

\[D_o = D_i + 2 * WT\]
Parameters

  • Di – pipe inner diameter \((D_i)\)

  • WT (float, list, tuple) – pipe wall thickness, or list/tuple of wall thicknesses

Returns

pipe outer diameter \((D_o)\)

Return type

float

>>> Do_from_pipe_Di(0.660, 0.045)
0.75
>>> Do_from_pipe_Di(203.2, [3, 45, 5])
309.2
pdover2t.pipe.pipe_props.pipe_cs_area(*, Do=None, Di=None, WT=None)[source]¶

Calculate pipe cross sectional area by specifying at least two of the three dimensional arguments outer diameter Do, inner diameter Di, wall thickness WT.

Parameters

  • Do – pipe outer diameter \((D_o)\)

  • Di – pipe inner diameter \((D_i)\)

  • WT (float) – pipe wall thickness \((WT)\)

Returns

pipe cross sectional area

Return type

float

>>> pipe_cs_area(Do=0.660, WT=0.05)
0.09581857593448868
pdover2t.pipe.pipe_props.pipe_cs_mass(density, csa)[source]¶
Calculate pipe cross sectional mass (per unit length),

by specifying the material density, and the pipe cross sectional area (csa).

param density

material density :math:`(

ho)`
type p_d

float

param csa

pipe cross sectional area \((pipe_{CSA})\)

type p_d

float

returns

pipe cross section mass per unit length

rtype

float

\[pipe_{cs_mass} = \]

ho * pipe_{CSA}

>>> pipe_cs_mass(7850, 0.095818)
752.1713
pdover2t.pipe.pipe_props.pipe_radial_dimensions(*, Do=None, Di=None, WT=None)[source]¶

Resolve pipe radial dimensions. Given two of three dimensional arguments outer diameter Do; inner diameter Di; wall thickness WT; calculate the missing dimension and return a tuple (Do, Di, WT).

If all arguments are specified a consistency check is carried out, and an AssertionError is raised if the dimensions are inconsistent.

Parameters

  • Do – pipe outer diameter \((D_o)\)

  • Di – pipe inner diameter \((D_i)\)

  • WT (float) – pipe wall thickness \((WT)\)

Returns

outer diameter, inner diameter, wall thickness

Return type

tuple

>>> pipe_radial_dimensions(Do=0.660, WT=0.05)
(0.66, 0.56, 0.05)

pdover2t.dnvgl_st_f101¶

pdover2t.dnvgl_st_f101.pressure_containment¶

pdover2t.dnvgl_st_f101.pressure_containment.external_pressure(h_l, rho_water, g=9.81) → p_e[source]¶

Water pressure, external to pipe.

pdover2t.dnvgl_st_f101.pressure_containment.incid_ref_press(p_d, gamma_inc) → p_inc[source]¶

Calculate DNVGL-ST-F101 «incidental reference pressure».

Parameters

  • p_d (float) – design pressure \((p_d)\)

  • gamma_inc (float) – incidental to design pressure ratio \((\gamma_{inc})\)

Returns

p_inc incidental reference pressure \((p_{inc})\)

Return type

float

Reference: DNVGL-ST-F101 (2017-12)

eq:4.3 sec:4.2.2.2 page:67 \((p_{inc})\)

>>> incid_ref_press(100e5, 1.1)
11000000.0
pdover2t.dnvgl_st_f101.pressure_containment.local_incid_press(p_d, rho_cont, h_l, h_ref, gamma_inc=1.1, g=9.81) → p_li[source]¶

Calculate local incidental pressure. Also applicable for local system test pressure.

Parameters

  • p_d (float) – design pressure at ref elevation \((p_d)\)

  • rho_cont (float) – density of pipeline contents \((\rho_{cont})\)

  • h_l (float) – elevation of the local pressure point \((h_l)\)

  • h_ref (float) – elevation of the reference point \((h_{ref})\)

  • gamma_inc (float) – incidental to design pressure ratio \((\gamma_{inc})\)

  • g (float) – gravitational acceleration \((g)\)

Returns

p_li local incidental pressure \((p_{li})\)

Return type

float

\[p_{li} = p_{inc} - \rho_{cont} \cdot g \cdot \left( h_l - h_{ref} \right)\]

Reference: DNVGL-ST-F101 (2017-12)

sec:4.2.2.2 eq:4.1 page:67 \((p_{li})\)
sec:4.2.2.2 eq:4.2 page:67 \((p_{lt})\) 
>>> local_incid_press(100.e-5, 1025, -125, 30)
1558563.751
pdover2t.dnvgl_st_f101.pressure_containment.local_test_press(p_t, rho_t, h_l, h_ref, p_e=None, alpha_spt=None, g=9.81) → p_lt[source]¶

Calculate local test pressure.

Reference: DNVGL-ST-F101 (2017-12)

sec:4.2.2.2 eq:4.2 page:67 $p_{lt}$ sec:5.4.2.1 eq:5.6 page:93 $p_{li}$

(local_test_press)

pdover2t.dnvgl_st_f101.pressure_containment.system_test_press(p_d, gamma_inc, alpha_spt) → p_t[source]¶

Calculate DNVGL-ST-F101 «system test pressure».

(system_test_press)

Parameters

  • p_d (float) – design pressure \((p_d)\)

  • gamma_inc (float) – incidental to design pressure ratio \((\gamma_{inc})\)

  • alpha_spt (float) – system pressure test factor \((\alpha_{spt})\)

Returns

p_t system test pressure \((p_t)\)

Return type

float

Reference: DNVGL-ST-F101 (2017-12)

eq:4.3 sec:4.2.2.2 page:67 \(p_{inc}\)
table:5.8 sec:5.4.2.1 page:94 \(\alpha_{spt}\)
sec:5.2.2.1 page:84 
>>> incid_ref_press(100e5, 1.1)
11000000.0
